intro: Pulmonaria gallorum, commonly known as the lungwort of the gall, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of velvety, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers, typically in shades of purple or blue, during the spring. Its foliage is covered in fine, glandular hairs, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. Pulmonaria gallorum is often found in moist, shaded woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens.
